'''Nether fossils''' are fossils that generate in [[soul sand valley]]s that can sometimes contain [[dried ghast]]s.

== Generation ==
Nether fossils generate randomly throughout the Nether in [[soul sand valley]]s.

Due to a bug, Nether fossils in ''Bedrock Edition'' have been seen generating in existing chunks.{{cn|Needs bug tracker or video reports}}

== Structure == 
{{Main|/Structure}}
Nether fossils are composed of 5 to 27 [[bone block]]s. Unlike regular [[fossil]]s, they do not have a lowered [[Structure Block#Load|structure integrity]] and no blocks are replaced with [[Coal Ore|coal]] or [[diamond ore]]. They are made with the NBT [[structure block]] format and the NBT files for each fossil are stored in the folder {{code|[[minecraft.jar]]/data/minecraft/structures/nether_fossils}}.

Nether fossils have a <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>3</sub> (~33.3%) chance of generating a [[dried ghast]] adjacent to them.

There are 14 different variants of Nether fossils:

{{Issue list}}
== Trivia ==
* Nether fossils are one of the 3 [[generated structures]] that never generate with loot chests (the others being [[swamp hut]]s and [[ocean monument]]s).
* Nether fossils do not have [[coal ore]], [[deepslate diamond ore]], or [[diamond ore]], like their counterparts (Overworld [[fossil]]s).
*While Overworld fossils are considered [[feature]]s like trees, Nether fossils are considered [[structure]]s instead.
